properties.name: Build with Bazel
properties.description: Build a project with Bazel.[View User Guide](https://support.huaweicloud.com/intl/en-us/usermanual-codeci/codeci_ug_0103.html)

parameters.name: command
parameters.label: Commands
parameters.defaultValue:
# Replace this content with actual values. 
# Predefined content:
# <workspace>: Workspace directory of the project
# <path>: Package location
# <target-name>: Build rule name in the BUILD file

# Go to the workspace directory.
# For the java-maven project in the official demo, run: cd java-maven
cd <workspace>
# Build a JAR package. 
# Example: bazel  build //:java-maven_deploy.jar
bazel build //<path>:<target-name>_deploy.jar
#Build a local package.
# For the c project in the official demo, run: cd cpp-tutorial/stage1    bazel build //main:hello-world
#bazel build //<path>:<target-name>
# Create an upload directory and copy the build package to it.
mkdir build_out
cp -r  bazel-bin/<path>/*  build_out/
# If you have added an action for uploading software package to Release Repos, modify the package location in the action.

data.description: Build a project with Bazel.[View User Guide](https://support.huaweicloud.com/intl/en-us/usermanual-codeci/codeci_ug_0103.html)
data.name: Build with Bazel

properties.name: Build with Go
properties.description: Build your Go project.

parameters.name: command
parameters.label: Commands
parameters.defaultValue:
# Build with the vendor folder. 
 export GO15VENDOREXPERIMENT=1 
 export GOPROXY=https://goproxy.cn
 ##Create the source folder in the working directory. 
 mkdir -p $GOPATH/src/example.com/demo/ 
 ## Copy code to this directory.
 cp -rf . $GOPATH/src/example.com/demo/ 
 ## Download dependencies if you are not using vendor. 
 #go get 
 ## Build and generate a package in the GOPATH. 
 go install example.com/demo 
 ## is generated in GOPATH. Copy the build result from GOPATH/bin (GOPATH/pkg). Upload the software package using 
 cp -rf $GOPATH/bin/ ./bin 
 ## When Go 1.17 or higher is used, the build command can be changed to 
 # go build main.go 
 # mkdir bin 
 # cp -fa main bin 
 ## or exec  
 #go build directory_name (multiple Go files exist in the directory) 
 # mkdir bin 
 # cp -fa project_name bin.

data.description: Build your Go project. [View User Guide](https://support.huaweicloud.com/intl/en-us/usermanual-codeci/codeci_ug_0012.html)
data.name: Build with Go

properties.name: Build Android App with Ionic
properties.description: Develop an Android app with Ionic, an HTML5 mobile app development framework.

parameters.name: command
parameters.label: Commands
parameters.defaultValue:
npm config set registry http://7.223.219.40/npm/
npm cache clean -f
# Add an Android compilation platform.
ionic cordova platform add android
# Hybrid compilation 
ionic cordova build android

properties.name: mono
properties.description: Compile a project with MSBuild and .NET on Mono Linux (x86 and Arm).[View User Guide](https://support.huaweicloud.com/intl/en-us/usermanual-codeci/codeci_01_0011.html)

steps.displayName: Compile a project with MSBuild and .NET on Mono Linux (x86 and Arm).

parameters.name: command
parameters.label: Commands
parameters.defaultValue:
# Restore dependencies and tools, and compile and package the dotnetcore project as archive.zip.
  #dotnet restore -s https://repo.huaweicloud.com/repository/nuget/v3/index.json
  #dotnet publish  -c Release -o ./app
  #zip -rq archive.zip ./app/*
# Restore dependencies and tools, and compile and package the project built with MSBuild as archive.zip.
nuget sources Disable -Name 'nuget.org' 
nuget sources add -Name 'huaweicloud' -Source 'https://repo.huaweicloud.com/repository/nuget/v3/index.json' 
nuget restore
msbuild /p:OutputPath=../buildResult/Release/bin
zip -rq ./archive.zip ./buildResult/Release/bin/*

data.description: Compile a project with MSBuild and .NET on Mono Linux (x86 and Arm).[View User Guide](https://support.huaweicloud.com/intl/en-us/usermanual-codeci/codeci_01_0011.html)
data.name: mono

parameters.name: command
parameters.label: Commands
parameters.defaultValue:
export PATH=$PATH:~/.npm-global/bin
# Set the cache directory.
npm config set cache /npmcache
npm config set prefix '~/.npm-global'
npm config set registry http://7.223.219.40/npm/

# For Node.js 18 or higher: Configure the .npmrc file. For earlier versions: use these command lines.
npm config set disturl http://7.223.219.40/nodejs
npm config set sass_binary_site http://7.223.219.40/node-sass/
npm config set phantomjs_cdnurl http://7.223.219.40/phantomjs
npm config set chromedriver_cdnurl http://7.223.219.40/chromedriver
npm config set operadriver_cdnurl http://7.223.219.40/operadriver
npm config set electron_mirror http://7.223.219.40/electron/
npm config set python_mirror http://7.223.219.40/python

# Load dependencies.
npm install --verbose --prefer-offline
# Build projects with default settings.
npm run build
#tar -zcvf demo.tar.gz ./**

data.description: Build Vue and Webpack projects with npm. [View User Guide](https://support.huaweicloud.com/intl/en-us/usermanual-codeci/codeci_ug_0007.html)
data.name: Build with npm

properties.name: Build in PHP
properties.description: Declare, install, and package the PHP libraries your project depends on using the PHP runtime environment and Composer.[View User Guide](https://support.huaweicloud.com/intl/en-us/usermanual-codeci/codeci_01_0012.html)

parameters.name: command
parameters.label: Commands
parameters.defaultValue:
# Specify global Composer repository address.
composer config -g secure-http false
composer config -g repo.packagist composer http://7.223.219.40/php/
 
composer install
tar -zcvf php-composer.tgz *

parameters.name: command
parameters.label: Commands
parameters.defaultValue:
pip config set global.index-url http://mirrors.tools.huawei.com/pypi/simple
pip config set global.trusted-host mirrors.tools.huawei.com
# Use pip or easy_install to download dependencies.
# pip install --user -r requirements.txt
# Ensure that setup.py exists in the root directory and package the project as an egg. 
python setup.py bdist_egg
# Package the project as a WHL file.
# python setup.py bdist_wheel
# Package the project as source code. 
#python setup.py sdist
# Release the packages.
#twine upload dist/*

validation.patternDescription: Can only include letters, digits, underscores (_), hyphens (-), question marks (?), asterisks (*), and dots (.). (Max. 128 characters)

parameters.helpMarkdown: Directory for storing the build result. A regular expression is supported. For Maven, use \*\*/target/\*.?ar to match all JAR and WAR packages.

parameters.name: buildVersion
parameters.label: Version

validation.patternDescription: Can only include letters, digits, underscores (_), hyphens (-), and dots (.). (Max. 128 characters)

parameters.helpMarkdown: Not specified (recommended): The directory for storing the file uploaded to Release Repo will be named after the build ID. Specified: Files in the storage directory with the same name may be overwritten.[View Details](https://support.huaweicloud.com/intl/en-us/usermanual-codeci/codeci_ug_0038.html#section3)

parameters.name: name
parameters.label: Package Name
parameters.helpMarkdown: Not specified (recommended): The file uploaded to Release Repo will use its original name. Specified: When multiple files are uploaded, the files may be overwritten.

parameters.name: command
parameters.label: Commands
parameters.defaultValue:
export PATH=$PATH:~/.npm-global/bin
# Set the cache directory.
npm config set cache-folder /yarncache
npm config set prefix '~/.npm-global'
npm config set registry http://7.223.219.40/npm/

# For Node.js 18 or higher: Configure the .npmrc file. For earlier versions: use these command lines.
npm config set disturl http://7.223.219.40/nodejs
npm config set sass_binary_site http://7.223.219.40/node-sass/
npm config set phantomjs_cdnurl http://7.223.219.40/phantomjs
npm config set chromedriver_cdnurl http://7.223.219.40/chromedriver
npm config set operadriver_cdnurl http://7.223.219.40/operadriver
npm config set electron_mirror http://7.223.219.40/electron/
npm config set python_mirror http://7.223.219.40/python

# Load dependencies.
yarn install --verbose
# Build projects with default settings.
yarn run build
tar -zcvf demo.tar.gz ./**

data.description: Build a JavaScript project with Yarn.[View User Guide](https://support.huaweicloud.com/intl/en-us/usermanual-codeci/codeci_01_0008.html)
data.name: Build with Yarn

properties.name: Build with CMake
properties.description: Build a project with CMake, a cross-platform build tool.

parameters.name: command
parameters.label: Commands
parameters.defaultValue:
# Create and switch to the build directory. 
 mkdir build && cd build 
 # Generate Unix Makefiles and execute the build task. 
 cmake -G 'Unix Makefiles' ../ && make -j

data.description: Build a project with CMake, a cross-platform build tool. [View User Guide](https://support.huaweicloud.com/intl/en-us/usermanual-codeci/codeci_ug_0010.html)
data.name: Build with CMake

properties.name: Build with Android
properties.description: Build an APK with the Android build system.

parameters.name: command1
parameters.label: Commands
parameters.defaultValue:
# Use Gradle Wrapper for cache acceleration.
cp /cache/android/wrapper/gradle-wrapper.jar ./gradle/wrapper/gradle-wrapper.jar
# Build an unsigned APK.
/bin/bash ./gradlew assembleDebug -Dorg.gradle.daemon=false -d --stacktrace

parameters.name: command
parameters.label: Commands
parameters.defaultValue:
# Use Gradle Wrapper for cache acceleration.
cp /cache/android/wrapper/gradle-wrapper.jar ./gradle/wrapper/gradle-wrapper.jar
# Build an unsigned APK.
/bin/bash ./gradlew assembleDebug -Dorg.gradle.daemon=false -d --stacktrace

properties.name: Unit Test Report
properties.description: Process the unit test result.[View User Guide](https://support.huaweicloud.com/intl/en-us/usermanual-codeci/codeci_ug_0105.html)

parameters.name: file
parameters.label: Test Report Path
parameters.helpMarkdown: A JUnit test report path (XML) relative to the project root directory. Example: target/surefire-reports/TEST-*.xml

parameters.name: junitCoverageSwitch
parameters.label: Release Test Coverage Report
parameters.helpMarkdown: JaCoCo and Cobertura unit test coverage reports are supported.

parameters.name: coverageReportPath
parameters.label: Test Coverage Report Path
parameters.helpMarkdown: XML or HTML test coverage report path relative to the project root directory. Example: target/site/jacoco/jacoco.xml. You can use wildcards such as * and ** for fuzzy match.
parameters.placeHolder: Enter a report path or directory.

validation.patternDescription: Max. 1,024 characters.

data.description: Process the unit test result.[View User Guide](https://support.huaweicloud.com/intl/en-us/usermanual-codeci/codeci_ug_0105.html)
data.name: Unit Test Report

properties.name: Build with Maven
properties.tips: Build a project with Maven. [View User Guide](https://support.huaweicloud.com/intl/en-us/usermanual-codeci/codeci_ug_00051.html)
properties.description: Build a Java project with Apache Maven.

group.helpMarkdown: For dependencies not provided in Huawei Mirrors, Self-hosted Repos, and Huawei SDK repository.
group.name: controller_setting

group.helpMarkdown: Opt to add deployment configuration to pom.xml so that dependencies can be released to Self-hosted Repos using mvn deploy.
group.name: controller_pom

group.helpMarkdown: Opt to print unit test results to control task execution.
group.name: controller_test

group.helpMarkdown: Opt to use CodeArts Build cache to accelerate the build.
group.name: controller_enabled

parameters.name: userPublicRepositories
parameters.label: Public Repositories
parameters.helpMarkdown: For dependencies not provided in Huawei Mirrors and Huawei SDK repository.

validation.patternDescription: Must start with https:// or http://.

parameters.name: userPrivateRepositories
parameters.label: Private Repositories
parameters.helpMarkdown: For dependencies not provided in Self-hosted Repos.

parameters.name: deal
parameters.label: Print Test Results
parameters.helpMarkdown: If Yes, add -Dmaven.test.failure.ignore=true to the end of the mvn command.

parameters.name: ignoreTest
parameters.label: Ignore Test Failure
parameters.helpMarkdown: If Yes, tasks can still be built to continue the pipeline when a test fails.

parameters.name: file
parameters.label: Test Report
parameters.helpMarkdown: Currently, only .xml reports are supported. Enter a relative path in the project. Example: target/surefire-reports/TEST*.xml

parameters.name: junitCoverageSwitch
parameters.label: Print Test Coverage
parameters.helpMarkdown: If you select Yes, ensure that your project uses jacoco-maven-plugin.

parameters.name: coverageReportPath
parameters.label: Report Location
parameters.helpMarkdown: A relative path in the project whose files will all be uploaded. Example: target/site/jacoco

parameters.name: cacheOption
parameters.label: Use Dependency Cache
parameters.helpMarkdown: Opt to cache dependencies in each build so that they will not be pulled for other builds.

parameters.name: command
parameters.label: Commands
parameters.defaultValue:
# Package a project. 
# Parameters: 
#		-Dmaven.test.skip=true: Skip unit tests. 
#		-U: Check dependency updates to avoid outdated snapshots. This will affect the performance. 
#		-e -X: Print debugging information to locate build problems. 
#		-B: Run in batch mode to avoid ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException during log printing. 
# Package a project without performing unit tests. 
mvn package -Dmaven.test.skip=true -U -e -X -B

# Package a project, perform unit tests while ignoring failures, and check dependency updates. 
# Perform unit tests and use test reports for analysis. 
# Enable test report printing and specify the storage location. 
#mvn package -Dmaven.test.failure.ignore=true -U -e -X -B

# Package a project and release dependencies to Self-hosted Repos. 
# Release build results to Self-hosted Repos for other Maven projects. 
# Release the build results to Self-hosted Repos, not Release Repos. 
#mvn deploy -Dmaven.test.skip=true -U -e -X -B

parameters.name: dependencyProjectDir
parameters.label: Pom.xml Directory
parameters.helpMarkdown: Relative path of the pom.xml

parameters.name: dependencySettings
parameters.label: Settings.xml Directory
parameters.helpMarkdown: Path to the settings.xml

parameters.name: dependencyCheckParam
parameters.label: Param
parameters.helpMarkdown: Ex: -Dmaven.test.skip=true

data.description: Build a Java project with Apache Maven. [View User Guide](https://support.huaweicloud.com/intl/en-us/usermanual-codeci/codeci_ug_00051.html)
data.name: Build with Maven

properties.name: Upload Files to OBS
properties.description: Upload files to OBS.

parameters.name: authorizationUser
parameters.label: Authorized Account
parameters.helpMarkdown: Upload build results to an OBS bucket of the current or another account.

parameters.name: iamEndPoint
parameters.label: Account Name
parameters.helpMarkdown: Access key ID (AK) and secret access key (SK) are used like passwords to authenticate users. To manage your AK/SK, go to the management console, click the username in the upper right, and choose My Credentials.

parameters.name: artifactSourcePath
parameters.label: Build Directory

validation.patternDescription: The command is too long. Invalid value.

parameters.helpMarkdown: Directory for storing the build results. If no file name is specified for OBS storage, use wildcard characters to upload multiple files. Example: **/target/*.?ar uploads all JAR and WAR packages built with Maven.

parameters.name: backetName
parameters.label: Bucket Name

validation.patternDescription: The command is too long. Invalid value.

parameters.helpMarkdown: Name of an OBS bucket in the region you are uploading the build results.

parameters.name: obsEndPoint
parameters.label: OBS EndPoint

validation.patternDescription: The command is too long. Invalid value.

parameters.helpMarkdown: An endpoint facilitates access to resources within a region.The default value is the current region

parameters.name: objectKey
parameters.label: OBS Directory

validation.patternDescription: The command is too long. Invalid value.

parameters.helpMarkdown: Directory for storing the build results. Blank or ./: root directory

parameters.name: artifactDestName
parameters.label: File Name
parameters.helpMarkdown: New name (excluding directory) for the built file after OBS storage. Leave this blank to upload multiple files with their old names, or specify a name to upload a single file. Example: application.jar

validation.patternDescription: The command is too long. Invalid value.

parameters.name: rootDirectory
parameters.label: Ignored Folder Path

validation.patternDescription: The command is too long. Invalid value.

parameters.helpMarkdown: When selecting the upload folder, some folders are ignored based on this path and are not uploaded to OBS. If the build result path is set to target/api/api.jar, the ignored folder path is set to target, and the obs storage directory is set to ./, api.jar will be uploaded to the api/api.jar path of the OBS bucket.If the path cannot be matched, folders in the path are not ignored by default.

parameters.name: obsHeaders
parameters.label: Headers
parameters.helpMarkdown: One or more headers that will be included in the response to download objects or query the object metadata. For example, set the key to x-frame-options and value to false to avoid third-party web pages in OBS.

validation.patternDescription: The command is too long. Invalid value.

data.description: Upload to OBS. [View User Guide](https://support.huaweicloud.com/intl/en-us/usermanual-codeci/codeci_01_0006.html)
data.name: Upload Files to OBS

properties.name: Build with HarmonyOS
properties.description: Build Harmony application with Hvigor.

parameters.name: command
parameters.label: Commands
parameters.defaultValue:
#when version is  HarmonyOS-API9
#ArkTS Build
#npm config set strict-ssl false
#npm config set registry=https://repo.huaweicloud.com/repository/npm/
#npm config set @ohos:registry=https://repo.harmonyos.com/npm/

#chmod +x hvigorw
#./hvigorw clean assembleApp --no-daemon


#when version is  HarmonyOS-5.0.0-API12
#ArkTS Build
ohpm config set strict_ssl false
ohpm config set registry https://ohpm.openharmony.cn/ohpm/
npm config set strict-ssl false
npm config set registry=https://repo.huaweicloud.com/repository/npm/
npm config set @ohos:registry=https://repo.harmonyos.com/npm/

ohpm install
cd entry
cd - 
ohpm install

hvigorw clean --no-daemon
hvigorw assembleHap --mode module -p product=default -p debuggable=false --no-daemon

data.description: Build Harmony application with Hvigor.[View User Guide](https://support.huaweicloud.com/intl/en-us/usermanual-codeci/codeci_ug_0115.html)
data.name: Build with HarmonyOS

properties.name: Build Image and Push to SWR
properties.description: Build an image with a Dockerfile and push the image to SWR. [View User Guide](https://support.huaweicloud.com/intl/en-us/usermanual-codeci/codeci_ug_0013.html)

steps.displayName: Build Image and Push to SWR

parameters.name: registryUrl
parameters.label: Image Repository
parameters.helpMarkdown: Repository for uploading Docker images. Select SWR or another container image repository.

parameters.name: endpointUuid
parameters.label: Docker Repository Endpoint
parameters.helpMarkdown: Select a user-defined docker repository. Click Create on the right to create a new docker repository endpoint. Click Manage to manage the new endpoint.

parameters.name: iamEndPoint
parameters.label: IAM Account
parameters.helpMarkdown: AK/SK (Access Key ID/Secret Access Key) represents a set of key pairs, which are used to authenticate the identity of the visitor who invokes the API to initiate the request, similar in function to the password. You can log in to the management console, click your username in the upper right corner, click 'My Credentials', and select 'Access Keys' in the left navigation bar to manage your key.

parameters.name: selectRegion
parameters.label: Push Region
parameters.helpMarkdown: The built image will be pushed to SWR repository in this region.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.label: Organization
parameters.helpMarkdown: Only organizations in the current region of the current user are displayed. Other regions or users can manually enter the organization name.

validation.patternDescription: Must start with a digit or letter and can only include lowercase letters, digits, underscores (_), and hyphens (-). (Max. 255 characters) Invalid value.
Do not start with a dot (.) or hyphen (-). Can only include letters, digits, dots (.), underscores (_), and hyphens (-). (Max. 128 characters) Invalid value.

parameters.name: contextPath
parameters.label: Working Directory
parameters.helpMarkdown: Where Docker build will be executed.

parameters.name: dockerFilePath
parameters.label: Dockerfile Path
parameters.helpMarkdown: Relative path to the working directory.

parameters.name: buildArgList
parameters.label: Build Parameters
parameters.helpMarkdown: set parameters during the build process using the --build-arg option

parameters.name: cache
parameters.label: Use Cache
parameters.helpMarkdown: If you decide not to use cache, docker build will use --pull and --no-cache to build an image.

parameters.name: setMetaData
parameters.label: Add Build Metadata to Image
parameters.helpMarkdown: Add the build information to the image. After the image is created, run the 'docker inspect' command to view the image metadata.

data.description: Build an image with a Dockerfile and push the image to SWR. [View User Guide](https://support.huaweicloud.com/intl/en-us/usermanual-codeci/codeci_ug_0013.html)
data.name: Build Image and Push to SWR

properties.name: Gradle
properties.tips: Build a project with Gradle. [View User Guide](https://support.huaweicloud.com/intl/en-us/usermanual-codeci/codeci_ug_0008.html)
properties.description: Build a Java, Groovy, or Scala project with Gradle.

parameters.name: command1
parameters.label: Commands
parameters.defaultValue:
# Use Gradle Wrapper for cache acceleration.
cp /cache/android/wrapper/gradle-wrapper.jar ./gradle/wrapper/gradle-wrapper.jar
# Build an unsigned APK.
/bin/bash ./gradlew build --init-script  ./.codeci/.gradle/init_template.gradle -Dorg.gradle.daemon=false -Dorg.gradle.internal.http.connectionTimeout=800000

parameters.name: command
parameters.label: Commands
parameters.defaultValue:
# Use Gradle Wrapper for cache acceleration.
cp /cache/android/wrapper/gradle-wrapper.jar ./gradle/wrapper/gradle-wrapper.jar
# Build an unsigned APK.
/bin/bash ./gradlew build --init-script  ./.codeci/.gradle/init_template.gradle -Dorg.gradle.daemon=false -Dorg.gradle.internal.http.connectionTimeout=800000

data.description: Build a Java, Groovy, or Scala project with Gradle.[View User Guide](https://support.huaweicloud.com/intl/en-us/usermanual-codeci/codeci_ug_0008.html)
data.name: Build with Gradle

properties.name: Upload to Release Repo
properties.description: Upload to Release Repo

parameters.name: file
parameters.label: Package Location

validation.patternDescription: Max. 128 characters

parameters.helpMarkdown: Directory for storing the build result. A regular expression is supported. For Maven, use \*\*/target/\*.?ar to match all JAR and WAR packages.

parameters.name: buildVersion
parameters.label: Version

validation.patternDescription: Can only include letters, digits, underscores (_), hyphens (-), and dots (.). (Max. 128 characters)

parameters.helpMarkdown: Not specified (recommended): The directory for storing the file uploaded to Release Repo will be named after the build ID. Specified: Files in the storage directory with the same name may be overwritten.[View Details](https://support.huaweicloud.com/intl/en-us/usermanual-codeci/codeci_ug_0038.html#section3)

parameters.name: name
parameters.label: Package Name

validation.patternDescription: Can only include letters, digits, underscores (_), hyphens (-), and dots (.). (Max. 128 characters)

parameters.helpMarkdown: Not specified (recommended): The file uploaded to Release Repo will use its original name. Specified: When multiple files are uploaded, the files may be overwritten.

parameters.name: customUploadPath
parameters.label: Custom Directory

validation.patternDescription: Max. 1024 characters

parameters.helpMarkdown: Uploads build artifacts to a directory named "custom directory/version number/software package name". Ensure that the product storage path length is not greater than the system upper limit.

parameters.name: remainOriginPath
parameters.label: Artifact Storage
parameters.helpMarkdown: Specify the kind of directory structure to use after upload (flat or original structure in the package path).

data.description: Upload a software package to Release Repo. [View User Guide](https://support.huaweicloud.com/intl/en-us/usermanual-codeci/codeci_ug_0038.html)
data.name: Upload to Release Repo
